actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Thursday, May 8, 2025,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, May 8, 2025, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S. 1582 (Sen. Hagerty):
        A bill to provide for the regulation of payment stablecoins, and for other purposes.

        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of measure made in Senate.

PN12-10:
        Monica Crowley, of New York, to be Chief of Protocol, and to have the rank of Ambassador during her tenure of service

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 241 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 242 



 PN12-31:
        Emil Michael, of Florida, to be Under Secretary of Defense for Research and Engineering

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN25-11:
        Sean Donahue, of Florida, to be an Assistant Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN25-50:
        Reed Rubinstein, of Maryland, to be Legal Adviser of the Department of State

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 243 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 5/13/2025.


 PN26-46:
        Eric Matthew Ueland, of Virginia, to be Deputy Director for Management, Office of Management and Budget

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Thune, at  8:57 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
